bibl.title: Letter from William Crawford Gorgas to Howard A. Kelly, November 30, 1907

div1.p: Gorgas confirms Ross's story concerning Carroll and Guiteras.

div1.head: Letter from William Crawford Gorgas to Howard A. Kelly, November 30, 1907
div1.opener:
The Breslin
Broadway & 29th Street
New York.
THE BRESLIN HOTEL COMPANY
PROPRIETOR
----
TELEPHONE 1448 MEDICAL
November 30, 1907.
Dr. Howard A. Kelly,
Dear Doctor Kelly:-
div1.p:
I have recently received from Dr. John W.
Ross of the Navy, enclosed correspondence. My recollections
of the circumstance is about as Dr. Ross stated. Dr. Carroll
had been given the run of Las Animas Hospital and of our la-
baratory situated there. Dr. Guiteras was in immediate
charge of the hospital and labaratory. Dr. Carroll had been
getting blood from patients and doing work at the labaratory
for sometime. He wanted to get blood in a considerable quan-
tity, two or three ounces, from certain quite sick patients.
Dr. Guiteras demurred at this from the point of view of the
patient. He referred the matter to Dr. Ross and Dr. Ross to
me. I concurred with Dr. Guiteras entirely, believing that
from our point of view the patient should be the first con-
sideration. I have not seen Dr. Carroll's letter referred to
by you. We were all very much interested in Dr. Carroll's
work and anxious to furnish him every facility. Guiteras,
just as much as myself. There was never the least desire to
put any difficulty in his way at Las Animas. Carroll naturally
only saw the matter from the scientific side. Our duty to the

Broadway & 29th Street
New York.
THE BRESLIN HOTEL COMPANY
PROPRIETOR
